intro: Polyscias stonei, commonly known as the New Zealand nettle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and typically grows as an upright shrub with a dense, bushy appearance. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by dark blue or black berries. Polyscias stonei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
